title: Adding Measles to the List of Quarantinable Communicable Diseases

enrichment.summary: This executive order adds measles to the official list of diseases for which people can be subject to quarantine by the federal government to help prevent the spread of the disease. It updates prior orders to ensure measles is considered a quarantinable communicable disease under U.S. public health law.
potential_concerns: Adding measles to the quarantinable diseases list may raise concerns about civil liberties and the potential for overreach in enforcing quarantine measures.
Implementation could be challenging due to the need for coordination among federal agencies and potential resource constraints.
There may be public resistance or confusion about quarantine requirements, especially among communities with vaccine hesitancy.
The order does not outline specific enforcement mechanisms, which could lead to inconsistent application across jurisdictions.
